column5: Can anyone give me some information about this resort located 40 miles north of Sioux Lookout. Looking for info on quality of the cabins, service from staff, proximity to good walleye and norhtern fishing, etc. Any information would be appreciated. Gary

Lac Seul Outposts is a well run operation, we have been there four times over the past 8 years or so. The cabins are nice, the VIP cabins are real nice, particularly given the remoteness of the location. Walleye fishing and Pike fishing is very good as is the Muskie fishing. It's a good ride in, about an hour or so depending on your boat but once there you are in some good water. See the above post on Chamberlin Narrows for some current fishing tips. You do have the chance of a real big Pike or Muskie in this area as some real trophy fish have been caught out of this camp in the past.Paul
here http://www.lacseuloutposts.com Here is there web site we are going up the last week of september. Good luck Livewire
